dcterms:creator: G. Danabasoglu
J.-F. Lamarque
J. Bacmeister

dcterms:description: The dataset consists of the pre-industrial control simulation (piControl) from the Community Earth System Model (CESM2), which is used to predict natural variability of the North Atlantic sea surface temperature on the interannual timescale.
dcterms:title: Community Earth System Model (CESM2) piControl simulation

dcterms:creator: G. Danabasoglu
J.-F. Lamarque
J. Bacmeister
D. Bailey
A. DuVivier
J. Edwards
others
dcterms:description: The CMIP archive provides access to various climate model simulations, including the CESM2 piControl simulation, which is utilized for climate prediction tasks.
dcterms:title: CMIP archive

dcterms:creator: C. Jiang
B. Nadiga
A. Farimani
dcterms:description: This dataset focuses on the interannual variability of climate using deep learning techniques, providing insights into climate prediction methodologies.
dcterms:title: Interannual variability of climate using deep learning

dcterms:creator: S. Rasp
P. D. Dueben
S. Scher
J. A. Weyn
S. Mouatadid
N. Thuerey
dcterms:description: The Weatherbench dataset serves as a benchmark for data-driven weather forecasting, providing a standardized dataset for evaluating forecasting models.
dcterms:title: Weatherbench dataset

dcterms:creator: C. E. Leith
dcterms:description: The damped persistence model (AR1) is a theoretical model used to assess the skill of Monte Carlo forecasts in climate prediction.
dcterms:title: Damped persistence model (AR1)
